== Preparations ==
<nowiki>[[TechnicalStuff|Here]]</nowiki> you can read some technical stuff about this model of laptop.
=== Enviroment ===
* All test were or will be performed on laptop that I use daily for different purposes.
* I'll always use ''one partiton'' instalation ie. all system and user data will be placed on one "guest OS" partition (<code>/dev/hda4</code>).
* I'll use ''swap'' partition which was created earlier for daily-used Ubuntu instalation (<code>/dev/hda5</code>).<<BR>>
* Sample instalation guide I might provide later.
=== Assumptions ===
** all test were/will be performed with '''Final Releases''' of Ubuntu ''Desktop'' OS.
*** installation performed '''without''' network (fresh CD install),
*** some test were/will be performed with open source '''and''' with binary ATI driver,
*** if something will start to work after update via network it'll be emphased.
** (dist-)upgrades were/will be performed only on base instalation + 
*** full system update,
*** packages needed for proper laptop work (if any),
*** ATI binary driver installed (but not used while upgrading),
*** WPA-enabled NetworkManager installed,
*** Ubuntu localization packages installed (in my case for Polish language),
** if any problem occur I'll try to provide a way to solve it.

* [0] All drivers downloaded from Ubuntu repository
* [1] Driver download needed
** installed via <code>sudo aptitude xorg-driver-fglrx</code>
** customized <code>/etc/X11/xorg.conf</code> TODO: link to file
* [2] If Bluetooth device is disabled (eg. by HP Tool provided with pre-installed Windows) it won't work. <<BR>>To bring blue Wi-Fi led to live follow these steps:
** create/edit <code>/etc/modprobe.d/ipw2200</code> file eg. <code>Alt+F2</code> + <code>gksu gedit /etc/modprobe.d/ipw2200</code>
** add following text: <code>options ipw2200 led=1</code>
** reboot
* [3] Additional software download needed + additional configuration
** easy install with <code>sudo aptitude install network-manager-gnome</code>
** manual configuration needed
*** edit <code>/etc/network/interfaces</code> file eg. <code>Alt+F2</code> + <code>gksu gedit /etc/network/interfaces</code>
*** comment all interfaces with # (with '''one exception''' ie. <code>loopback</code> interface - usually first two lines in this file.<<BR>>I repeat '''DO NOT COMMENT LOOPBACK''' interface)
** reboot
* [4] Managed to get it to work (following step from ~-<nowiki>[[http://soften.ktu.lt/~s72482/nx8220/index.php?pid=4|Linux on HP Compaq nx8220 notebook]]</nowiki>-~)
** sudo sh -c "echo 'ircomm_tty' >> /etc/modules"
* [5] Manual config needed:
** System -> Preferences -> Sound -> Sound Capture -> Intel ICH6 - ADC2
* [6] Manual config needed:
** edit <code>/etc/X11/xorg.conf</code> file eg. <code>Alt+F2</code> + <code>gksu gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf</code>
** add <pre>
Section "Extensions"        
   Option  "Composite" "Disable"
EndSection
</pre>
** reboot
